intro: Cardamine alalata, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a small herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and alpine meadows. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three heart-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. Cardamine alalata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
